texts.value: Retina-specific kinase involved in the shutoff of the photoresponse and adaptation to changing light conditions via cone opsin phosphorylation, including rhodopsin (RHO)
Interacts (when prenylated) with PDE6D; this promotes release from membranes
Retinal cones, outer and inner segments
Autophosphorylated in vitro at Ser-490. Phosphorylation at Ser-36 is regulated by light and activated by cAMP
Although the protein is present in a diversity of vertebrates ranging from bony fish to mammals, the mouse and rat orthologous proteins do not exist
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. AGC Ser/Thr protein kinase family. GPRK subfamily

features.description: in a metastatic melanoma sample; somatic mutation
No effect on kinase activity. Increase kinase activity; when associated with A-36.
No effect on kinase activity. Increase kinase activity; when associated with A-23.

citation.title: Characterization of human GRK7 as a potential cone opsin kinase.

Phosphorylation of GRK1 and GRK7 by cAMP-dependent protein kinase attenuates their enzymatic activities.

Patterns of somatic mutation in human cancer genomes.
